attributes.Title: Global Heritage & The City
attributes.Description:
Spring
2015
Heritage Studies
563
UMass Amherst
This seminar will develop the basic themes, concepts, and case studies required to theorize and analyze global, national, regional and local urban heritage sites in comparative perspective. No prerequisites.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
19329
19328
Requisite: This seminar will develop the basic themes, concepts, and case studies required to theorize and analyze global, national, regional and local urban heritage sites in comparative perspective. No prerequisites.

attributes.Title: Intro Intl Heritage Studies
attributes.Description:
Fall
2014
Heritage Studies
560
UMass Amherst
This seminar focuses on various aspects of public commemorations of tangible and intangible heritage. History and trends of US and international heritage administration will be explored. Open to graduate students; advanced undergraduate students admitted with instructor permission.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
79001
